trans-unit.source: Set up a Linux RDMA cluster to run MPI applications | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up a Linux RDMA cluster to run MPI applications | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a Linux cluster of size A8 or A9 VMs to use RDMA to run MPI apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a Linux cluster of size A8 or A9 VMs to use RDMA to run MPI apps.

trans-unit.source: Set up a Linux RDMA cluster to run MPI applications
trans-unit.target: Set up a Linux RDMA cluster to run MPI applications

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to set up a Linux RDMA cluster in Azure with [size A8 and A9 virtual machines](virtual-machines-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md) to run parallel Message Passing Interface (MPI) applications.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to set up a Linux RDMA cluster in Azure with [size A8 and A9 virtual machines](virtual-machines-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md) to run parallel Message Passing Interface (MPI) applications.

trans-unit.source: When you configure size A8 and A9 Linux-based VMs to run a supported MPI implementation, MPI applications communicate efficiently over a low latency, high throughput network in Azure that is based on remote direct memory access (RDMA) technology.
trans-unit.target: When you configure size A8 and A9 Linux-based VMs to run a supported MPI implementation, MPI applications communicate efficiently over a low latency, high throughput network in Azure that is based on remote direct memory access (RDMA) technology.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Linux RDMA is currently supported with Intel MPI Library version 5.0 running on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 (SLES 12).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Linux RDMA is currently supported with Intel MPI Library version 5.0 running on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 (SLES 12).

trans-unit.source: Azure also provides A10 and A11 compute intensive instances, with processing capabilities identical to the A8 and A9 instances, but without a connection to an RDMA backend network.
trans-unit.target: Azure also provides A10 and A11 compute intensive instances, with processing capabilities identical to the A8 and A9 instances, but without a connection to an RDMA backend network.

trans-unit.source: To run MPI workloads in Azure, you will generally get best performance with the A8 and A9 instances.
trans-unit.target: To run MPI workloads in Azure, you will generally get best performance with the A8 and A9 instances.

trans-unit.source: Linux cluster deployment options
trans-unit.target: Linux cluster deployment options

trans-unit.source: Following are methods you can use to create a Linux RDMA cluster either with or without a job scheduler.
trans-unit.target: Following are methods you can use to create a Linux RDMA cluster either with or without a job scheduler.

trans-unit.source: **HPC Pack** - You can create a Microsoft HPC Pack cluster in Azure and add compute nodes that run supported Linux distributions (supported starting in HPC Pack 2012 R2 Update 2).
trans-unit.target: **HPC Pack** - You can create a Microsoft HPC Pack cluster in Azure and add compute nodes that run supported Linux distributions (supported starting in HPC Pack 2012 R2 Update 2).

trans-unit.source: Some Linux nodes can be configured to access the RDMA network.
trans-unit.target: Some Linux nodes can be configured to access the RDMA network.

trans-unit.source: See the [HPC Pack documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=617894) to get started.
trans-unit.target: See the [HPC Pack documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=617894) to get started.

trans-unit.source: **Azure CLI scripts** - You can use the [Azure Command Line Interface](../xplat-cli.md) (CLI) for Mac, Linux, and Windows to build your own scripts to deploy a virtual network and the other necessary components to create a Linux cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Azure CLI scripts** - You can use the [Azure Command Line Interface](../xplat-cli.md) (CLI) for Mac, Linux, and Windows to build your own scripts to deploy a virtual network and the other necessary components to create a Linux cluster.

trans-unit.source: The CLI in Azure Service Management (asm) mode will deploy the cluster nodes serially, so if you are deploying many compute nodes it might take several minutes to complete the deployment.
trans-unit.target: The CLI in Azure Service Management (asm) mode will deploy the cluster nodes serially, so if you are deploying many compute nodes it might take several minutes to complete the deployment.

trans-unit.source: See steps in the rest of this article for an example.
trans-unit.target: See steps in the rest of this article for an example.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Resource Manager templates** - By creating a straightforward Azure Resource Manager JSON template file and running Azure CLI arm-mode commands or using the Azure Preview Portal, you can deploy multiple A8 and A9 Linux VMs as well as define virtual networks, static IP addresses, DNS settings, and other resources to create a compute cluster that can take advantage of the RDMA network and run MPI workloads.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Resource Manager templates** - By creating a straightforward Azure Resource Manager JSON template file and running Azure CLI arm-mode commands or using the Azure Preview Portal, you can deploy multiple A8 and A9 Linux VMs as well as define virtual networks, static IP addresses, DNS settings, and other resources to create a compute cluster that can take advantage of the RDMA network and run MPI workloads.

trans-unit.source: You can [create your own template](../resource-group-authoring-templates.md), or check the [Azure Quickstart Templates page](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/templates/) for templates contributed by Microsoft or the community to deploy the solution you want.
trans-unit.target: You can [create your own template](../resource-group-authoring-templates.md), or check the [Azure Quickstart Templates page](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/templates/) for templates contributed by Microsoft or the community to deploy the solution you want.

trans-unit.source: Resource Manager templates generally provide the fastest and most reliable way to deploy a Linux cluster.
trans-unit.target: Resource Manager templates generally provide the fastest and most reliable way to deploy a Linux cluster.

trans-unit.source: On Linux VMs, Eth1 is reserved for RDMA network traffic.
trans-unit.target: On Linux VMs, Eth1 is reserved for RDMA network traffic.

trans-unit.source: Do not change any Eth1 settings or any information in the configuration file referring to this network.

trans-unit.source: In Azure IP over Infiniband (IB) is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Only RDMA over IB is supported.
